Our employees are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.


Our employee promise represents Intact's commitment to you in exchange for living our Values, striving to do your best work, being open to change and investing in your career. In return, we promise to provide support, opportunities and performance-led financial rewards at a workplace where you can shape the future, win as a team and grow with us.

About the role

Launching your career at Intact means joining a diverse community of experts that trust and value your skills in an industry that is constantly evolving. Here, you'll receive mentorship and coaching in a dynamic hands-on environment. You'll drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in our organization, for our customers, and across our communities. You'll grow personally and professionally with access to advanced learning platforms and make lasting connections near and far. Most importantly, you'll discover how exciting the "real world" can be.


Here, your career will take off

At Intact, we're leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future talent - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our team as a Security Analyst I for the Summer 2025 term. In this role, you'll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.

We are looking for 1 intern to join our Governance, Risk, and Compliance security team!

What you'll do here:

Be the first point of contact to handle the team's intake requests for cybersecurity risk and compliance related activities
Support and maintain the risk register, derogations, and third-party risk assessment-related activities
Work closely with the team's Scrum Master or Product Owner and other stakeholders to prioritize and triage requests
Maintain the repository for baseline documentation and standard operating procedures
Assist the team's Business Analyst to prepare and report on Cybersecurity metrics and key indicators
Oversee documentation, implementation and testing for the organization's cybersecurity risk management tools
Act as an expert in security incident response within the security monitoring team and on other security initiatives and projects.
Stay up to date with information security newsfeeds, techniques and trends, threat landscape, attacks techniques, detection methods, etc.
Make recommendations to improve security monitoring and provide advisories to other teams and projects to improve the company's protection.
Executes periodical review procedures for IT security procedures by producing relevant reports and by following up with accountable stakeholders.

What you bring to the table:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's (or Master's, if applicable) degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering
Available to work with us full-time, 35 hours per week, for the Summer 2025 Term (May to August)
Must be an active student during your internship and/or returning to school in Fall 2025 following your internship
Past internship experience in security is considered an asset
Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and/or French preferred).
Ability and desire to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment
Knowledge in security concepts such as, GRC (governance, risk, and compliance), risk assessments, mitre attacks, vulnerability, threat risk assessment, etc.
Experience in Python, PowerShell Scripting, AWS, Azure, GCP, and/or OCI is considered an asset
Experience with control testing or reviewing operating systems and databases, and/or incident response is considered an asset
Experience using Microsoft Visio is considered an asset
Working towards one of these certifications would be a considerable asset: CISSP, CISA, CISM, CGEIT, CRISC, GSEC, GISP

The annual salary range of the successful candidate will typically be positioned between the following, taking into consideration a number of factors including prior experience, qualifications, anticipated contribution to role, location and internal equity: $55,680 - $66,120.
